de.unisiegen.tpml.core.smallstep
Class SmallStepProofModel

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.util.beans.AbstractBean
      de.unisiegen.tpml.core.AbstractProofModel
          de.unisiegen.tpml.core.interpreters.AbstractInterpreterProofModel
              de.unisiegen.tpml.core.smallstep.SmallStepProofModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
InterpreterProofModel, ProofModel, Bean, TreeModel
public final class SmallStepProofModel
extends AbstractInterpreterProofModel

The heart of the small step interpreter. Smallstep rules are supplied via an AbstractSmallStepProofRuleSet that is passed to the constructor.

Version:
$Rev: 486 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
AbstractInterpreterProofModel, SmallStepProofNode

Constructor Detail

SmallStepProofModel

public SmallStepProofModel(Expression expression,
                           AbstractSmallStepProofRuleSet ruleSet)
Allocates a new SmallStepProofModel with the specified expression as its root node.

Parameters:
expression - the Expression for the root node.
ruleSet - the available small step proof rules for the model.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if either expression or ruleSet is null.
See Also:
AbstractInterpreterProofModel.AbstractInterpreterProofModel(AbstractInterpreterProofNode, AbstractProofRuleSet)
Method Detail

guess

public void guess(ProofNode node)
           throws ProofGuessException
Guesses the next proof step for the specified node. The node must not be already proven (see the ProofNode.isProven() method for details), otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Specified by:
guess in interface ProofModel
Specified by:
guess in class AbstractProofModel
Parameters:
node - the ProofNode for which the next proof step should be guessed.
Throws:
ProofGuessException - if the next proof step could not be guessed.
See Also:
AbstractProofModel.guess(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.ProofNode)

prove

public void prove(ProofRule rule,
                  ProofNode node)
           throws ProofRuleException
Applies the given proof rule to the specified proof node. The node must not be already proven (see the ProofNode.isProven() method for details), otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Specified by:
prove in interface ProofModel
Specified by:
prove in class AbstractProofModel
Parameters:
rule - the ProofRule to apply.
node - the ProofNode to which the rule should be applied.
Throws:
ProofRuleException
See Also:
AbstractProofModel.prove(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.ProofRule, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.ProofNode)

remaining

public ProofStep[] remaining(ProofNode node)
Returns the remaining ProofSteps required to prove the specified node. This method is used to guess the next step, see the guess(ProofNode) method for further details, and in the user interface, to highlight the next expression.

Parameters:
node - the ProofNode for which to return the remaining steps required to prove the node.
Returns:
the remaining ProofSteps required to prove the node, or an empty array if the node is already proven or the evaluation is stuck.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the node is invalid for the model.
NullPointerException - if node is null.

addUndoableTreeEdit

protected void addUndoableTreeEdit(AbstractProofModel.UndoableTreeEdit edit)
Adds the specified edit to the undo history. The current redo history is cleared.

Overrides:
addUndoableTreeEdit in class AbstractProofModel
Parameters:
edit - the AbstractProofModel.UndoableTreeEdit to add.
See Also:
AbstractProofModel.addUndoableTreeEdit(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.AbstractProofModel.UndoableTreeEdit)
